Authors: Mario Rajchenberg, Alina Greslebin, Karen K Nakasone
Title: Rhizochaete–a new genus of phanerochaetoid fungi.
Abstract:
A new basidiomycete genus, Rhizochaete (Phanerochaetaceae,
Polyporales), is described. Rhizochaete is characterized by a smooth to
tuberculate, pellicular hymenophore and hyphal cords that turn red or
violet in potassium hydroxide, monomitic hyphal system of simple or
nodose septate hyphae, cystidia, and small, cylindrical to subglobose
basidiospores. Morphologically, it is most similar to Phanerochaete.
Analyses of nuclear ribosomal and internal transcribed spacer region
sequence data support a close relationship of Rhizochaete to
Phanerochaete. The new taxon R. brunnea, from southern Argentina, is
described and illustrated. In addition, the new combinations R.
americana, R. borneensis, R. filamentosa, R. fouquieriae and R. radicata
are proposed. A key to the species of Rhizochaete is provided.
